lead_paragraph: Russian tennis chief Shamil Tarpishchev expects Maria Sharapova to represent her country at this year's Olympics in Brazil despite being provisionally suspended from the game after testing positive for a banned substance.

headline.print_headline: Russia Tennis Chief Still Expects Sharapova to Play at Olympics
headline.main: Russia Tennis Chief Still Expects Sharapova to Play at Olympics

snippet: Russian tennis chief Shamil Tarpishchev expects Maria Sharapova to represent her country at this year's Olympics in Brazil despite being provisionally suspended from the game after testing positive for a banned substance....
